meanings.definition: The process of making something secular or non-religious.
meanings.sent1: The secularization of the holiday decorations made them more inclusive.
meanings.sent2: The secularization of the school curriculum aimed to create a neutral learning environment.
meanings.sent3: The secularization of the church bake sale meant no more religious-themed treats.
meanings.sent4: Her wardrobe underwent a secularization, shifting from religious attire to modern fashion.
meanings.sent5: The secularization of the event transformed it into a community celebration.

meanings.definition: The act of removing religious influence or control from a society or institution.
meanings.sent1: Secularization of the government policies ensured separation of church and state.
meanings.sent2: The secularization of the legal system led to more impartial judgments.
meanings.sent3: The secularization of the school cafeteria menu caused a stir among students.
meanings.sent4: In the play, the character symbolized secularization by breaking free from religious norms.
meanings.sent5: The secularization of the library collection reflected a diverse range of beliefs.
